page.title: 19FARMING AROUND BURY AREA
page.content: Mr. E. Lambert has lived in Ramsey all his life and has been farming for about 40 years.He owns 27.5 hectres of land on which he grows potatoes,cereals and sugar beet.His family helps with all the work so he does'nt employ farm hands.He owns Â£30000 worth of eqiupment.He spends about Â£2500 on fertiliser per year. Mr.Lambert inherited some of the farm, he bought some of it and he also rents a couple of fields.When he retires the farm will be split and sold.He is not employed by the government.COMMON MARKET.It was good at first but now he thinks it is bad.We import more than we export.Alot of our surpluss food is either destroyed or given to Russia. The French have more money than the English out of the Common Market because they can't farm.
